snippet: Hassan Rowhani, who advocates greater personal freedoms and a more conciliatory approach to the world, avoided a runoff in the election to replace Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.
abstract: Hassan Rouhani, mild-mannered cleric who advocates greater personal freedoms and more conciliatory approach to the world, wins commanding 50.7 percent of vote in elections for Iran's presidency; result is striking repudiation of ultraconservatives who wield power in the country.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Hassan Rowhani, who advocates greater personal freedoms and a more conciliatory approach to the world, avoided a runoff in the election to replace Mahmoud Ahmadinejad.

headline.main: Iran Moderate Wins Presidency by a Large Margin
headline.print_headline: Iran Moderate Wins Presidency By Large Margin
